metadata.synopsis: A working-class woman (Bette Midler) raises her out-of-wedlock daughter (Trini Alvarado) alone, then lets her go to her rich father.

reviews: This is convoluted classist reasoning at its worst.
Stella is, in the end, foiled by a host of negative attributes that conspire to cement the movie's place as a seriously dull little drama.
Stella may be corny, but it's got a great big heart.
